_comment: ------ On the Dynamics of Integration contents ------
info_book.integratedmekanism.manual.intr: &lIntegrated Mekanism&r is an extension to &lIntegrated Dynamics&r to that adds deep integration with the &lMekanism&r mod.

This mod allows you to read properties of chemical-related machines, apply operators over them, transfer chemicals over networks, access chemicals using the &lStorage Terminal&r, and perform autocrafting using chemicals.
info_book.integratedmekanism.manual.logi: This mod adds a dedicated value type to represent references to a &lMekanism&r chemical. For example &8Sodium&0, &8Oxygen&0, &8Dirty Gold Slurry&0, &8Biomass&0, ....

Chemicals are also supported in &8Recipes&0 and &8Ingredients&0. For chemical-based recipes, a more convenient entry in the &lLogic Programmer&r is available under the name Chemical Recipe. This has support for mods such as JEI.
Chemical values are also fully supported within mods such as &lIntegrated Scripting&r and &lIntegrated REST&r.
A part that adds information about the chemical machine the part is facing.
Parts such as the &lWorld Reader&r and &lMachine Reader&r have some additional aspects to read information about things such as radiation and fission reactor statistics.
&8Chemical&0 values can be used within a variety of operators, for example to check if something is radioactive, or reading its conductivity.
info_book.integratedmekanism.manual.tunn: Just like you're used to transferring items, fluids, and energy using &lIntegrated Tunnels&r, you can transfer chemicals in the same way.

&lWARNING:&r The &lChemical Tanks&r from &lMekanism&r do not allow chemical interaction from all sides by default. So you may have to explicitly allow &lInput/Output&r for the connected side within the &lChemical Tank&r GUI.

The &lChemical Interface&r exposes chemical tanks to the network, and the &lChemical Importer&r and &lChemical Exporter&r respectively import to and export from them. For more advanced scenarios, you can use the &lWorld Chemical Importer&r, &lWorld Chemical Exporter&r, and &lFiltering Chemical Interface&r.
info_book.integratedmekanism.manual.term: When at least one valid &lChemical Interface&r is attached to your network, the &lStorage Terminal&r will allow you to interact with all chemicals in your network, in the same way you are used to interacting with items, fluids, and energy.
info_book.integratedmekanism.manual.craf: Auto-crafting with chemicals works in exactly the same way as for items, fluids, and energy. You can create recipes within the &lLogic Programmer&r (Chemical Recipe), or read all available recipes in a machine using the &lMachine Reader&r. These recipes can be inserted in the &lCrafting Interface&r for autocrafting with at places such as the &lCrafting Writer&r or the &lStorage Terminal&r.

&lWARNING:&r The &lChemical Tanks&r from &lMekanism&r do not allow chemical interaction from all sides by default. So you may have to explicitly allow &lInput/Output&r for the connected side within the &lChemical Tank&r GUI.
info_book.integratedmekanism.tutorials.i: This section contains several tutorials that help you to learn &lIntegrated Mekanism&r, the &lIntegrated Dynamics&r add-on that adds deep integration with the &lMekanism&r mod.
info_book.integratedmekanism.tutorials.r: Let's read some information within a &lChemical Tank&r! For this, we first need to craft a &lChemical Reader&r, and attach it to a &lCable&r so it faces a &lChemical Tank&r.
Next, try reading out whether or not the tank is empty using a &lVariable Card&r, and display it in a &lDisplay Panel&r.
Then, try reading the Chemical contents of the tank, and display it in a &lDisplay Panel&r.

Finally, apply the &lIs Radioactive&r operator within the &lLogic Programmer&r to this Chemical value, and read out the final value by placing the resulting &lVariable Card&r in a &lDisplay Panel&r. (don't forget to place all intermediary variables within a &lVariable Store&r!)
info_book.integratedmekanism.tutorials.t: Now, we're going to try moving some chemicals over our network. For this, we first need to craft a &lChemical Interface&r, and attach it to a &lCable&r so it faces a &lChemical Tank&r.

&lWARNING:&r The &lChemical Tanks&r from &lMekanism&r do not allow chemical interaction from all sides by default. So you may have to explicitly allow &lInput/Output&r for the connected side within the &lChemical Tank&r GUI.
Next, craft a &lChemical Importer&r and place it on a cable so it faces another &lChemical Tank&r, and import ALL chemicals.
Finally, craft a &lChemical Exporter&r and place it on a cable so it faces another &lChemical Tank&r, and export one specific chemical (e.g. Sodium).

There are multiple ways to create a &8Chemical&0 value. You can for example create one directly within the &lLogic Programmer&r, searching for "Chemical", and dragging and dropping a tank containing a chemical from your inventory or JEI.
